Hint: if no child Normal node is provided, the X3D browser shall automatically generate normals, using creaseAngle to determine smoothed shading across shared vertices.
attribute.name: normalPerVertex

attribute.tooltip: [solid &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Setting solid true means draw only one side of polygons (backface culling on), setting solid false means draw both sides of polygons (backface culling off). Warning: default value true can completely hide geometry if viewed from wrong side! Hint: if in doubt, use solid='false' for maximum visibility.
attribute.name: solid

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "geometry"] containerField is a field-label prefix indicating this node's field relationship to its parent node, for example <Transform><Shape containerField='children'/></Transform>. Hint: default containerField values for each node are correct in most cases, so the need to override default containerField values is rare. Hint: example values include containerField='geometry' for Box node, containerField='children' for Group node, containerField='proxy' for hidden proxy shape within a Collision node, etc. Hint: containerField attribute is part of XML encoding for X3D scenes, and corresponds to the always-declared field labels in the ClassicVRML and VRML97 file encodings. Hint: USE node instances are allowed to have a containerField value that is different than the corresponding DEF declaration of that node. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] The class attribute is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by CSS cascading stylesheets. Warning: currently the class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes. Hint: W3C Cascading Style Sheets https://www.w3.org/Style/CSS
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: TriangleStripSet is a geometry node containing a Coordinate|CoordinateDouble node, and can also contain Color|ColorRGBA, Normal and TextureCoordinate nodes. Hint: color, normal and texCoord values are applied in the same order as coord values. Hint: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. Hint: for advanced extensibility, authors can substitute a type-matched ProtoInstance node (with correct containerField value) for contained node content.
element.name: TriangleStripSet

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USE references to previously defined DEF geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [ccw &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] ccw = counterclockwise: ordering of vertex coordinates orientation, according to Right-Hand Rule (RHR). Hint: ccw false can reverse solid (backface culling) and normal-vector orientation. Note that consistency of left-handed or right-handed point sequences is important throughout.
attribute.name: ccw

attribute.tooltip: [colorPerVertex &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether Color|ColorRGBA values are applied to each point vertex (true) or to each polygon face (false). Warning: if child Color|ColorRGBA node is not provided, then geometry is rendered using corresponding Appearance and material/texture values. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Color https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Color
attribute.name: colorPerVertex

attribute.tooltip: [normalPerVertex &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether Normal node vector values are applied to each point vertex (true) or to each polygon face (false). Hint: if no child Normal node is provided, the X3D browser shall automatically generate normals, using creaseAngle to determine smoothed shading across shared vertices.
attribute.name: normalPerVertex

attribute.tooltip: [solid &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Setting solid true means draw only one side of polygons (backface culling on), setting solid false means draw both sides of polygons (backface culling off). Warning: default value true can completely hide geometry if viewed from wrong side! Hint: if in doubt, use solid='false' for maximum visibility.
attribute.name: solid

attribute.tooltip: [stripCount &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] (3,+∞) stripCount array provides number of vertices in each strip. Warning: do not exceed number of points in contained Coordinate|CoordinateDouble node.
attribute.name: stripCount

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "geometry"] containerField is a field-label prefix indicating this node's field relationship to its parent node, for example <Transform><Shape containerField='children'/></Transform>. Hint: default containerField values for each node are correct in most cases, so the need to override default containerField values is rare. Hint: example values include containerField='geometry' for Box node, containerField='children' for Group node, containerField='proxy' for hidden proxy shape within a Collision node, etc. Hint: containerField attribute is part of XML encoding for X3D scenes, and corresponds to the always-declared field labels in the ClassicVRML and VRML97 file encodings. Hint: USE node instances are allowed to have a containerField value that is different than the corresponding DEF declaration of that node. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] The class attribute is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by CSS cascading stylesheets. Warning: currently the class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes. Hint: W3C Cascading Style Sheets https://www.w3.org/Style/CSS
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: Las vistas (viewpoints) son localizaciones y direcciones específicas donde el usuario puede visualizar la escena. Background, Fog, NavigationInfo y Viewpoint son nodos vinculables (bindables). Hint: GeoViewpoint OrthoViewpoint and Viewpoint share the same binding stack, so no more than one of these nodes can be bound and active at a given time. Warning: do not include GeoViewpoint OrthoViewpoint or Viewpoint as a child of LOD or Switch, instead use ViewpointGroup as parent to constrain location proximity where the viewpoint is available to user. Hint: Regardless of viewpoint jump value at bind time, the relative viewing transformation between user's view and defined position/orientation is stored for later use when un-jumping (returning to the viewpoint when subsequent viewpoint is unbound). Hint: customizable design pattern for dedicated Viewpoint/NavigationInfo pair: <Viewpoint DEF='SpecialView'/> <NavigationInfo DEF='SpecialNav'/> <ROUTE fromNode='SpecialView' fromField='isBound' toNode='SpecialNav' toField='set_bind'/> Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Viewpoints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Viewpoints
element.name: Viewpoint

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define un único identificador ID para este nodo, referenciable por otros nodos. Nota: nombres DEF descriptivos mejoran la claridad y ayudan a documentar un modelo. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reutilizar un nodo ya identificado con un ID mediante DEF, sin tener en cuenta todos los demás atributos e hijos. Nota: utilice USE, en vez de duplicar nodos, puede mejorar el rendimiento. Advertencia ¡NO incluya DEF (u otros valores de atributos) cuando se utilice un atributo USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [description &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Texto de descripción o nota de navegación a mostrar. Nota: use espacios, haga descripciones claras y leíbles. Nota: muchas herramientas XML sustituyen automáticamente las referencias a caracteres XML si se necesita (como & por & o " por ") Advertencia: sin description, es poco probable que Viewpoint aparezca en el menú de Viewpoints del navegador. Nota para el perfil de intercambio (interchange profile): este campo puede ser ignorado.
attribute.name: description

attribute.tooltip: [position &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 10"] Posición (x, y, z en metros) relativa al sistema de coordenadas local.
attribute.name: position

attribute.tooltip: [orientation &inputOutputLabel; &SFRotationLabel; "0 0 1 0]"; Rotación (eje, ángulo en radianes) de Viewpoint, relativa a la dirección del eje -Z por defecto de en el sistema de coordenadas local. Nota: esta es la dirección por defecto de cambio de orientación (orientation _change_ from) (0 0 -1) Nota: rotaciones complejas pueden conseguirse eje-por-eje usando Transforms padres.
attribute.name: orientation

attribute.tooltip: [fieldOfView &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.7854]" (0,π) Ángulo mínimo preferido de visión desde esta vista en radianes. Campo de visión pequeño corresponde aproximadamente a una lente telefoto (telephoto) Campo de visión grande corresponde aproximadamente a una lente gran ángulo (wide-angle) Modificando la distancia de Viewpoint al objeto puede ser mejor para el enfoque (zooming) Advertencia: fieldOfView puede no ser correcto para distintos tamaños de ventana y restricciones de aspecto. Nota para el perfil de intercambio (interchange profile): este campo puede ser ignorado.
attribute.name: fieldOfView

attribute.tooltip: [jump &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Transición instantánea saltando, o animando suavemente este Viewpoint. Nota: fije jump=true para movimiento suave de la cámara cuando se va hacia esta vista.
attribute.name: jump

attribute.tooltip: [centerOfRotation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] el punto centerOfRotation se propone como un anexo relativo al modo EXAMINE de NavigationInfo.
attribute.name: centerOfRotation

attribute.tooltip: [set_bind &inputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; ""] Fijar set_bind a true convierte este nodo en activo, fijar set_bind a false convierte este nodo en inactivo. De esta forma, fijando set_bind a true/false se habilitará/deshabilitará) este nodo. Hint: paired node operations can be established by connecting set_bind and isBound fields of corresponding bindable nodes. Warning: it is an error to define this transient inputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a destination for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: set_bind

attribute.tooltip: [bindTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "-1"] Evento enviado cuando el nodo se convierte en activo/inactivo. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: bindTime

attribute.tooltip: [isBound &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Evento a true enviado cuando el nodo se convierte en activo, evento a false enviado cuando es desactivado por otro nodo. Hint: paired node operations can be established by connecting set_bind and isBound fields of corresponding bindable nodes. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isBound

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] containerField es el campo-etiqueta usado como prefijo en la codificación VRML cuando este nodo es un hijo de otro nodo. Ejemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Group. Nota: puede ser sobreescrito por el autor si es necesario. Advertencia: el atributo containerField es sólo soportado por la codificación XML de las escenas. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class: CDATA #FIXED ""] class es un atributo reservado para uso de las hojas de estilo XML. Advertencia: el atributo class es sólo soportado por la codificación XML de las escenas.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: VisibilitySensor detecta cuándo el usuario puede ver un objeto o región específico cuando navega por el mundo. Esta región está limitada por una caja. Nota: a menudo se utiliza para atraer la atención del usuario o mejorar el rendimiento.
element.name: VisibilitySensor

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define un único identificador ID para este nodo, referenciable por otros nodos. Nota: nombres DEF descriptivos mejoran la claridad y ayudan a documentar un modelo. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reutilizar un nodo ya identificado con un ID mediante DEF, sin tener en cuenta todos los demás atributos e hijos. Nota: utilice USE, en vez de duplicar nodos, puede mejorar el rendimiento. Advertencia ¡NO incluya DEF (u otros valores de atributos) cuando se utilice un atributo USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Habilita/deshabilita el nodo sensor.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [center &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Balance de translación desde el origen del sistema de coordenadas local.
attribute.name: center

attribute.tooltip: [size &inputOutputLabel; SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Tamaño de la caja de visibilidad, medida desde el centro en metros.
attribute.name: size

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Eventos isActive true/false se envian cuando se dispara el sensor. isActive=true cuando se entra en la región de visibilidad, isActive=false cuando se sale de la región de visibilidad. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [enterTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0.0"] Evento de tiempo generado por el sensor cuando la cámara del usuario entra en la región de visibilidad. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: enterTime

attribute.tooltip: [exitTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0.0"] Evento de tiempo generado por el sensor cuando la cámara del usuario sale de la región de visibilidad. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: exitTime

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] containerField es el campo-etiqueta usado como prefijo en la codificación VRML cuando este nodo es un hijo de otro nodo. Ejemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Group. Nota: puede ser sobreescrito por el autor si es necesario. Advertencia: el atributo containerField es sólo soportado por la codificación XML de las escenas. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class: CDATA #FIXED ""] class es un atributo reservado para uso de las hojas de estilo XML. Advertencia: el atributo class es sólo soportado por la codificación XML de las escenas.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: WorldInfo contiene información persistente sobre el mundo 3D.
element.name: WorldInfo

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define un único identificador ID para este nodo, referenciable por otros nodos. Nota: nombres DEF descriptivos mejoran la claridad y ayudan a documentar un modelo. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reutilizar un nodo ya identificado con un ID mediante DEF, sin tener en cuenta todos los demás atributos e hijos. Nota: utilice USE, en vez de duplicar nodos, puede mejorar el rendimiento. Advertencia ¡NO incluya DEF (u otros valores de atributos) cuando se utilice un atributo USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [title &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] title of this world, placed in window title. Nota: muchas herramientas XML sustituyen automáticamente las referencias a caracteres XML si se necesita (como & por & o " por ")
attribute.name: title

attribute.tooltip: [info &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Información adicional sobre este mundo. Nota: las cadenas de caracteres (Strings) pueden tener múltiples valores, por eso separe cada cadena con comillas. "https://www.web3d.org" "https://www.web3d.org/about" "etc." Nota: muchas herramientas XML sustituyen automáticamente las referencias a caracteres XML si se necesita (como & por & o " por ")
attribute.name: info

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] containerField es el campo-etiqueta usado como prefijo en la codificación VRML cuando este nodo es un hijo de otro nodo. Ejemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Group. Nota: puede ser sobreescrito por el autor si es necesario. Advertencia: el atributo containerField es sólo soportado por la codificación XML de las escenas. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class: CDATA #FIXED ""] class es un atributo reservado para uso de las hojas de estilo XML. Advertencia: el atributo class es sólo soportado por la codificación XML de las escenas.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: Nodo XML más alto para un fichero de gráficos X3D. La etiqueta X3D contiene un único nodo Scene - Scene es el nodo raíz de la escena gráfica 3D. Nota: añada o seleccione una etiqueta Scene para editar la escena gráfica. Hint: X3D Architecture 7.2.5.2 Header statement https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#HeaderStatement
element.name: X3D

attribute.tooltip: [profile &profileNames; "Full"] Perfil de soporte necesario para la escena que contiene. Nota: Core corresponde a dispositivos de sólo salida (output-only devices) Nota: CoreInteractive corresponde a escenas gráficas simples. Nota: Base contiene los principales nodos VRML/X3D nodes pero ningún componente extra. Nota: Full contiene nodos Base más todos los componentes específicos. Warning: PROFILE is capitalized and is a separate statement in the ClassicVRML Encoding. Hint: X3D Architecture 7.2.5.3 PROFILE statement https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#PROFILEStatement
attribute.name: profile

attribute.tooltip: [version "3.0" #REQUIRED] X3D versión 3.0 corresponde a X3D/VRML 200x.
attribute.name: version

attribute.tooltip: [xmlns:xsd type CDATA "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"] XML namespace (xmlns) for XML Schema Definition (xsd). Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Validation of X3D Scenes using DTD and XML Schema https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Validation
attribute.name: xmlns:xsd

attribute.tooltip: [xsd:noNamespaceSchemaLocation type CDATA "https://www.web3d.org/specifications/x3d-3.0.xsd"] url for the X3D Schema defining the X3D document-validation rules. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Validation of X3D Scenes using DTD and XML Schema https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Validation
attribute.name: xsd:noNamespaceSchemaLocation

element.tooltip: Los comentarios pueden ser usados en cualquier sitio para hacer la escena más clara. Nota: sólo introduzca comentarios usando este nodo, no ponga comentarios en los valores de los atributos. Nota: comentarios VRML comienzand con un símbolo # y no tienen que ser conservados por un navegador. Nota: use WorldInfo para comentarios persistentes que pueden permanecer con un Scene.
element.name: XML_COMMENT

element.tooltip: TEXT (datos de texto).
element.name: XML_TEXT

element.tooltip: CDATA (Character Data) Sección Preserva datos de caracteres literales al pie de la letra. CDATA protege el texto contenido de cualquier sustitución XML. Nota: CDATA protege los operadores < y > operators en los códigos (Script) contenidos. Nota: comentarios VRML comienzan con un símbolo # symbol y no tienen que ser conservados por un navegador. Nota: use WorldInfo para comentarios persistentes que pueden permanecer con un Scene.
element.name: XML_CDATA

element.tooltip: Processing Instruction (PI) - Úselo para pasar direcciones e información a programas.
element.name: XML_PI

element.tooltip: Document Type Definition (DTD).
element.name: XML_DOCUMENT_TYPE

element.tooltip: EspduTransform is a networked Transform node that can contain most nodes. If activated, EspduTransform can send or receive Entity State Protocol Data Unit (PDU) packets using the IEEE Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS) protocol. EspduTransform integrates functionality for the following DIS PDUs: EntityStatePdu, CollisionPdu, DetonatePdu, FirePdu, CreateEntity and RemoveEntity packets. Hint: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/DistributedInteractiveSimulation.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='DIS' level='1'/>
element.name: EspduTransform

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USE references to previously defined DEF geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Habilita/deshabilita el nodo sensor.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [marking &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Maximum of 11 characters for simple entity label.
attribute.name: marking

attribute.tooltip: [siteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] siteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: siteID

attribute.tooltip: [applicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"] applicationID is unique for application at that site. Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: applicationID

attribute.tooltip: [entityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] entityID is unique ID for entity within that application.
attribute.name: entityID

attribute.tooltip: [forceID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] forceID determines the team membership of the issuing entity, and whether FRIENDLY OPPOSING or NEUTRAL or OTHER.
attribute.name: forceID

attribute.tooltip: [entityKind &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for whether entity is a PLATFORM, MUNITION, LIFE_FORM, ENVIRONMENTAL, CULTURAL_FEATURE, SUPPLY, RADIO, EXPENDABLE, SENSOR_EMITTER or OTHER.
attribute.name: entityKind

attribute.tooltip: [entityDomain &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for domain in which the entity operates: LAND, AIR, SURFACE, SUBSURFACE, SPACE or OTHER.
attribute.name: entityDomain

attribute.tooltip: [entityCountry &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for country to which the design of the entity or its design specification is attributed.
attribute.name: entityCountry

attribute.tooltip: [entityCategory &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for main category that describes the entity, semantics of each code varies according to domain. See DIS Enumerations values.
attribute.name: entityCategory

attribute.tooltip: [entitySubCategory &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for particular subcategory to which an entity belongs based on the Category field. See DIS Enumerations values.
attribute.name: entitySubCategory

attribute.tooltip: [entitySpecific &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Specific information about an entity based on the Subcategory field. See DIS Enumerations values.
attribute.name: entitySpecific

attribute.tooltip: [entityExtra &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Any extra information required to describe a particular entity. The contents of this field shall depend on the type of entity represented.
attribute.name: entityExtra

attribute.tooltip: [readInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0.1"] [0,+∞) Seconds between read updates, 0 means no reading. Hint: readInterval is a nonnegative SFTime duration interval, not an absolute clock time.
attribute.name: readInterval

attribute.tooltip: [writeInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "1.0"] [0,+∞) Seconds between write updates, 0 means no writing (sending). Hint: writeInterval is a nonnegative SFTime duration interval, not an absolute clock time.
attribute.name: writeInterval

attribute.tooltip: [networkMode &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; &DisNetworkModeValues; standAlone] Whether this entity is ignoring the network, sending DIS packets to the network, or receiving DIS packets from the network. (1) standAlone: ignore network but still respond to events in local scene. (2) networkReader: listen to network and read PDU packets at readInterval, act as remote copy of entity. (3) networkWriter: send PDU packets to network at writeInterval, act as master entity. Default value "standAlone" ensures that DIS network activation within a scene as networkReader or networkWriter is intentional. Warning: do not wrap extra quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values, since "quotation" "marks" are only used for MFString values.
attribute.name: networkMode

attribute.tooltip: [isStandAlone &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="local" (ignore network but still respond to local events) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isStandAlone

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkReader &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="remote" (listen to network as copy of remote entity) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkReader

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkWriter &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="master" (output to network as master entity at writeInterval) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkWriter

attribute.tooltip: [address &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; localhost] Multicast network address, or else "localhost" Example: 224.2.181.145.
attribute.name: address

attribute.tooltip: [port &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Network connection port number (EXAMPLE 3000) for sending or receiving DIS messages. Example: 3000.
attribute.name: port

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayHost &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Fallback server address if multicast not available locally. Example: track.nps.edu.
attribute.name: multicastRelayHost

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayPort &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Fallback server port if multicast not available locally. Example: 8010.
attribute.name: multicastRelayPort

attribute.tooltip: [rtpHeaderExpected &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Whether RTP headers are prepended to DIS PDUs.
attribute.name: rtpHeaderExpected

attribute.tooltip: [isRtpHeaderHeard &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; outputOnly #IMPLIED] Whether incoming DIS packets have an RTP header prepended. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isRtpHeaderHeard

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Have we received a network update recently? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [timestamp &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] DIS timestamp received from latest PDU update, converted to X3D SFTime units. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: timestamp

attribute.tooltip: [translation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Position of children relative to local coordinate system, usually read from (or written to) remote, networked EspduTransform nodes.
attribute.name: translation

attribute.tooltip: [rotation &inputOutputLabel; &SFRotationLabel; "0 0 1 0"] Orientation of children relative to local coordinate system, usually read from (or written to) remote, networked EspduTransform nodes.
attribute.name: rotation

attribute.tooltip: [center &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Translation offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: center

attribute.tooltip: [scale &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "1 1 1"] Non-uniform x-y-z scale of child coordinate system, adjusted by center and scaleOrientation.
attribute.name: scale

attribute.tooltip: [scaleOrientation &inputOutputLabel; &SFRotationLabel; "0 0 1 0"] Preliminary rotation of coordinate system before scaling (to allow scaling around arbitrary orientations).
attribute.name: scaleOrientation

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center accompanies bboxSize and provides an optional hint for bounding box position offset from origin of local coordinate system. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Bounding box size is usually omitted, and can easily be calculated automatically by an X3D player at scene-loading time with minimal computational cost. Bounding box size can also be defined as an optional authoring hint that suggests an optimization or constraint. Hint: can be useful for collision computations or inverse-kinematics (IK) engines. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [linearVelocity &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"]Velocity of the entity relative to the rotating Earth in either world or entity coordinates, depending on the dead reckoning algorithm used.
attribute.name: linearVelocity

attribute.tooltip: [linearAcceleration &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Acceleration of the entity relative to the rotating Earth in either world or entity coordinates, depending on the dead reckoning algorithm used.
attribute.name: linearAcceleration

attribute.tooltip: [deadReckoning &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Dead reckoning algorithm being used to project position/orientation with velocities/accelerations.
attribute.name: deadReckoning

attribute.tooltip: [isCollided &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Has a matching CollisionPDU reported a collision? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isCollided

attribute.tooltip: [collideTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] When were we collided with? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: collideTime

attribute.tooltip: [isDetonated &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Has a matching DetonationPDU reported a detonation? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isDetonated

attribute.tooltip: [detonateTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] When were we detonated?
attribute.name: detonateTime

attribute.tooltip: [fired1 &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Has the primary weapon (Fire PDU) been fired?
attribute.name: fired1

attribute.tooltip: [fired2 &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Has the secondary weapon (Fire PDU) been fired?
attribute.name: fired2

attribute.tooltip: [firedTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] When did we shoot a weapon (Fire PDU)? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: firedTime

attribute.tooltip: [munitionStartPoint &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Initial point of the munition path from firing weapon to detonation or impact, in exercise coordinates.
attribute.name: munitionStartPoint

attribute.tooltip: [munitionEndPoint &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Final point of the munition path from firing weapon to detonation or impact, in exercise coordinates.
attribute.name: munitionEndPoint

attribute.tooltip: [munitionSiteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Munition siteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: munitionSiteID

attribute.tooltip: [munitionApplicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"] munitionApplicationID, unique for application at that site. Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: munitionApplicationID

attribute.tooltip: [munitionEntityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] munitionEntityID is unique ID for entity firing munition within that application.
attribute.name: munitionEntityID

attribute.tooltip: [fireMissionIndex &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; #FIXED ""]
attribute.name: fireMissionIndex

attribute.tooltip: [warhead &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for type of warhead on the munition.
attribute.name: warhead

attribute.tooltip: [fuse &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for type of fuse on the munition.
attribute.name: fuse

attribute.tooltip: [munitionQuantity &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Quantity of munitions fired.
attribute.name: munitionQuantity

attribute.tooltip: [firingRate &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Rate at which munitions are fired.
attribute.name: firingRate

attribute.tooltip: [firingRange &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] Range (three dimension, straight-line distance) that the firing entity's fire control system has assumed for computing the fire control solution if a weapon and if the value is known
attribute.name: firingRange

attribute.tooltip: [collisionType &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumeration for type of collision: ELASTIC or INELASTIC.
attribute.name: collisionType

attribute.tooltip: [detonationLocation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] World coordinates for detonationLocation
attribute.name: detonationLocation

attribute.tooltip: [detonationRelativeLocation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Relative coordinates for detonation location
attribute.name: detonationRelativeLocation

attribute.tooltip: [detonationResult &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumeration for type of detonation and result that occurred., if any.
attribute.name: detonationResult

attribute.tooltip: [eventApplicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"]Simulation/exercise eventApplicationID is unique for events generated from application at that site. Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: eventApplicationID

attribute.tooltip: [eventEntityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] For a given event, simulation/exercise entityID is a unique ID for a single entity within that application.
attribute.name: eventEntityID

attribute.tooltip: [eventNumber &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Sequential number of each event issued by an application. Warning: reuse of numbers may be necessary during long simulation exercises.
attribute.name: eventNumber

attribute.tooltip: [eventSiteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Simulation/exercise siteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: eventSiteID

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterCount &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Number of articulated parameters attached to this entity state PDU.
attribute.name: articulationParameterCount

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterDesignatorArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Array of designators for each articulated parameter.
attribute.name: articulationParameterDesignatorArray

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterChangeIndicatorArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Array of change counters, each incremented when an articulated parameter is updated.#IMPLIED]
attribute.name: articulationParameterChangeIndicatorArray

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterIdPartAttachedToArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Array of ID parts that each articulated parameter is attached to.
attribute.name: articulationParameterIdPartAttachedToArray

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterTypeArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Array of type enumerations for each articulated parameter element.
attribute.name: articulationParameterTypeArray

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] Information required for representation of the entity's visual appearance and position of its articulated parts. Hint: renamed as Variable Parameter in IEEE DIS 2012 revised standard.
attribute.name: articulationParameterArray

attribute.tooltip: [geoSystem &initializeOnlyLabel; &GeoSystemType;] Identifies spatial reference frame: Geodetic (GD), Geocentric (GC), Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM). Supported values: "GD" "UTM" or "GC" followed by additional quoted string parameters as appropriate for the type. Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.2 Spatial reference frames https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Spatialreferenceframes Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.4 Specifying geospatial coordinates https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Specifyinggeospatialcoords Hint: UTM is Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Transverse_Mercator_coordinate_system Warning: deprecated values are GDC (replaced by GD) and GCC (replaced by GC).
attribute.name: geoSystem

attribute.tooltip: [geoCoords &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3dLabel; "0 0 0"] Geographic location (specified in current geoSystem coordinates) for children geometry (specified in relative coordinate system, in meters). Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/>
attribute.name: geoCoords

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is a field-label prefix indicating this node's field relationship to its parent node, for example <Transform><Shape containerField='children'/></Transform>. Hint: default containerField values for each node are correct in most cases, so the need to override default containerField values is rare. Hint: example values include containerField='geometry' for Box node, containerField='children' for Group node, containerField='proxy' for hidden proxy shape within a Collision node, etc. Hint: containerField attribute is part of XML encoding for X3D scenes, and corresponds to the always-declared field labels in the ClassicVRML and VRML97 file encodings. Hint: USE node instances are allowed to have a containerField value that is different than the corresponding DEF declaration of that node. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] The class attribute is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by CSS cascading stylesheets. Warning: currently the class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes. Hint: W3C Cascading Style Sheets https://www.w3.org/Style/CSS
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: ReceiverPdu is a networked Protocol Data Unit (PDU) information node that transmits the state of radio frequency (RF) receivers modeled in a simulation. Hint: ReceiverPdu packets use the IEEE Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS) protocol. Hint: Savage Developers Guide on DIS https://savage.nps.edu/Savage/developers.html#DIS Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/DistributedInteractiveSimulation.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='DIS' level='1'/>
element.name: ReceiverPdu

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USE references to previously defined DEF geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Habilita/deshabilita el nodo sensor.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [whichGeometry &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"] Select geometry to render: -1 for no geometry, 0 for text trace, 1 for default geometry, (optional) higher values to render different states.
attribute.name: whichGeometry

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center accompanies bboxSize and provides an optional hint for bounding box position offset from origin of local coordinate system. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Bounding box size is usually omitted, and can easily be calculated automatically by an X3D player at scene-loading time with minimal computational cost. Bounding box size can also be defined as an optional authoring hint that suggests an optimization or constraint. Hint: can be useful for collision computations or inverse-kinematics (IK) engines. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [siteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Simulation/exercise siteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: siteID

attribute.tooltip: [applicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"] Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: applicationID

attribute.tooltip: [entityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] EntityID unique ID for entity within that application.
attribute.name: entityID

attribute.tooltip: [readInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0.1"] [0,+∞) Seconds between read updates, 0 means no reading. Hint: readInterval is a nonnegative SFTime duration interval, not an absolute clock time.
attribute.name: readInterval

attribute.tooltip: [writeInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "1.0"] [0,+∞) Seconds between write updates, 0 means no writing (sending). Hint: writeInterval is a nonnegative SFTime duration interval, not an absolute clock time.
attribute.name: writeInterval

attribute.tooltip: [networkMode &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; &DisNetworkModeValues; standAlone] Whether this entity is ignoring the network, sending DIS packets to the network, or receiving DIS packets from the network. (1) standAlone: ignore network but still respond to events in local scene. (2) networkReader: listen to network and read PDU packets at readInterval, act as remote copy of entity. (3) networkWriter: send PDU packets to network at writeInterval, act as master entity. Default value "standAlone" ensures that DIS network activation within a scene as networkReader or networkWriter is intentional. Warning: do not wrap extra quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values, since "quotation" "marks" are only used for MFString values.
attribute.name: networkMode

attribute.tooltip: [isStandAlone &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="local" (ignore network but still respond to local events) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isStandAlone

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkReader &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="remote" (listen to network as copy of remote entity) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkReader

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkWriter &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="master" (output to network as master entity at writeInterval) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkWriter

attribute.tooltip: [address &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; localhost] Multicast network address, or else "localhost" Example: 224.2.181.145.
attribute.name: address

attribute.tooltip: [port &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Multicast network port, for example: 3000.
attribute.name: port

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayHost &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Fallback server address if multicast not available locally. For example: track.nps.edu.
attribute.name: multicastRelayHost

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayPort &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Fallback server port if multicast not available locally. For example: 8010.
attribute.name: multicastRelayPort

attribute.tooltip: [rtpHeaderExpected &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Whether RTP headers are prepended to DIS PDUs.
attribute.name: rtpHeaderExpected

attribute.tooltip: [isRtpHeaderHeard &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether incoming DIS packets have an RTP header prepended. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isRtpHeaderHeard

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Have we had a network update recently?. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [timestamp &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] DIS timestamp in X3D units (value 0.0 matches 1 January 1970) in seconds. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: timestamp

attribute.tooltip: [radioID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Identifies a particular radio within a given entity.
attribute.name: radioID

attribute.tooltip: [receivedPower &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] receivedPower indicates radio frequency (RF) power received, in units of decibel-milliwatts (dBm), after applying any propagation loss and antenna gain
attribute.name: receivedPower

attribute.tooltip: [receiverState &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] receiverState indicates if receiver is currently idle or busy via one of these enumerated values: 0 = off, 1 = on but not receiving, or 2 = on and receiving.
attribute.name: receiverState

attribute.tooltip: [transmitterSiteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Simulation/exercise transmitterSiteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: transmitterSiteID

attribute.tooltip: [transmitterApplicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"]Simulation/exercise transmitterApplicationID is unique for transmitter application at that site. Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: transmitterApplicationID

attribute.tooltip: [transmitterEntityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Simulation/exercise transmitterEntityID is a unique ID for a single entity within that application.
attribute.name: transmitterEntityID

attribute.tooltip: [transmitterRadioID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Identifies a particular radio within a given entity.
attribute.name: transmitterRadioID
